content: Which British naturalist is best known for his contributions to the science of evolution and his book "On the Origin of Species"?

Charles Darwin is the British naturalist best known for his contributions to the science of evolution and his groundbreaking book "On the Origin of Species." Published in 1859, this work introduced the theory of evolution through natural selection, which has since become a cornerstone of biological science. Darwin's observations during his voyage on the HMS Beagle and his subsequent research formed the basis of his theory, challenging prevailing views on the origin of species and sparking extensive scientific debate and discovery.
